original: Edgren, Carl Erik Gunnar, lasaretts-läkare, Halmstad, f. 19/5/08 i Gbg av Gottfrid E. o. Gerda Hellberg. G. 37 m. Sigrid Dolkemeier. Barn: Jan Gunnar f. 42. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 26, med. kand. i Upps. 30, med. lic. 35 o. med. dr där 43. Assist :läk. v. Akad. sjukh. med. o. pediatr. avd. 35-37, aman. o. und:läk. v. dess pediatr. avd. 37-43> und:läk. v. Halmstads länslas. med. avd. 43-45, extraläk. v. deS’S barn-avd. 45-46 samt las :läk. v. samma avd. sed. 46.
translated: Edgren, Carl Erik Gunnar, hospital doctor, Halmstad, born May 19, 1908 in Gothenburg to Gottfrid E. and Gerda Hellberg. He married Sigrid Dolkemeier in 1937 and they had one child together, Jan Gunnar, born in 1942. Carl graduated from high school in Gothenburg in 1926, obtained his Bachelor of Medicine in Uppsala in 1930, his medical license in 1935, and his doctorate in medicine in 1943, all from Uppsala University. He worked as an assistant doctor in the medical and pediatric departments of the Academic Hospital from 1935-1937, as well as an intern and resident in the pediatric department from 1937-1943. From 1943-1945 he worked as a resident doctor in the medical department of the Halmstad County Hospital, and from 1945-1946 he worked as an extra doctor in the children's department. Since 1946, he worked as a hospital doctor in the same department.
